data.title: CrowdAgent::Remove() cause crash
Segfault when reloading a scene with 2D constraint
Add new face camera mode to BillboardSet and Text3D.
data.body:
This PR is a small improvement of Urho's billboard system.

**LookAt Y** and **Rotate Y** modes are useful for rendering some grounded objects like grass or trees that shouldn't be freely rotated. Such billboards degrade when camera looks downside and this case is often unwanted.

This PR introduces new mode called **LookAt Mixed** that is a hybrid of **LookAt XYZ** and **LookAt Y**. New attribute **minAngle** controls minimum angle between billboard normal and look-at direction. 0 is **LookAt Y** mode, 90 is **LookAt XYZ**. Small values of **minAngle** allow user to have almost-lookat-Y billboards that don't degrade when looking downside. See screenshot.

Unfortunatelly, implementation for **Rotate Y**/**Rotate XYZ** looks much more difficult. But maybe it will be implemented at some point.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8576192/18288612/e29c4924-7484-11e6-9e2b-46fbe93fee40.png)

data.title: Unnecessary shader compilation defines
data.body: As a result from the added feature of shader defines in material, these are going to be applied indiscriminately to shaders that don't need them. For example PACKEDNORMAL defined in material gets applied to the shadow shader, though it doesn't read the normal map. Either detect actually used compilation defines from the shader code, or provide a mechanism (for example undef preprocessor statement) to specify unused defines in shader code.

data.title: Universal default shader?
data.body:
Is there a benefit to having the maze of different techniques compared to having a simple shader that can be dynamically changed from the material editor, for example if you add a normal map it will add the define for you in the material. The reason this comes to mind is i have been playing around with other engines and they all tend to stick to a standard shader system rather then techniques. 

In short we use the 1 shader per renderpath we have now but change the defines from the material, kinda like Unitys standard shader from example.

This would also allow a lot easier options for the user for example possibly a tick box for PBR, and a drop down for the diffuse model. If given help on the editor side then im more then happy to work on a standard shader.

data.title: Possibility to choose max anisotropy samples per textures
data.body:
Hello ! 

Would it be possible to be able to choose max anisotropy samples count on textures ? 

This would be very usefull for terrains ! Setting anisotropy samples to 8 or even more with 16 cause a massive framerate drops (more than 10 FPS drop) when the terrain is rendered on the screen. I guess that this is because the terrain is a big surface to process for the GPU. 

I have tried to force trilinear filtering on terrain texture and it solve the performance issue. Even if other meshes textures are anisotropic filtered there is only 2 FPS drop at worse.

The good thing would be to be able to set for example a maximum of 2 samples of anisotropic filtering on the terrain texture as trilinear filtering make the terrain quite blurry :)

Tested on DX11 desktop build with a Nvidia GTX 760.

data.title: How to create Lua bindings in downstream project?
data.body:
I want to write my game's core on C++ and my game's "frontend" on Lua. But I don't found any information about integrating Lua in **Urho3D downstream** project. I'm trying to implement it this way:
1. Create empty downstream project and add sample class to it. Link urho3d's tolua++ to my project's target.

``` cmake
set (TARGET_NAME Urho3DApplication)
define_source_files ()
setup_main_executable ()
target_link_libraries (Urho3DApplication tolua++)
```
1. Create .pkg for my sample class and run Urho3D's tolua++ tool.

``` bash
tolua++ -o generated/tolua_SampleClass.cpp pkgs/SampleClass.pkg
```
1. Add this include's to my Urho3DApplication.cpp:

``` c++
#include "generated/tolua++.h"
#include <Urho3D/LuaScript/ToluaUtils.h>
#include "generated/tolua_SampleClass.cpp"
```

And I get this error in linking step:

```
[ 66%] Linking CXX executable ..\bin\Urho3DApplication.exe
D:/mingw-w64/i686-4.9.2-posix-dwarf-rt_v3-rev1/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/4.9.2/../../../../i686-w64-mingw32/bin/ld.exe: 
cannot find -ltolua++

sources\CMakeFiles\Urho3DApplication.dir\build.make:124: recipe for target 'bin/Urho3DApplication.exe' failed
D:/mingw-w64/i686-4.9.2-posix-dwarf-rt_v3-rev1/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/4.9.2/../../../../i686-w64-mingw32/bin/ld.exe: 
cannot find -ltolua++

collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles\Makefile2:84: recipe for target 'sources/CMakeFiles/Urho3DApplication.dir/all' failed
makefile:93: recipe for target 'all' failed
mingw32-make[2]: *** [bin/Urho3DApplication.exe] Error 1
mingw32-make[1]: *** [sources/CMakeFiles/Urho3DApplication.dir/all] Error 2
mingw32-make: *** [all] Error 2
```

Github repository:
https://github.com/KonstantinTomashevich/urho3d-cxx-and-lua-intergration
How I can fix it?

data.title: Refactor Vector and PODVector implementation.
data.body:
Related to #1556.
I re-organized vector code to prevent old buffer destruction in case of reallocation until new buffer is constructed. I also removed this hacky macro and added one new ctor for both vectors.
**Upd:** I smoke-tested Editor and all demos.

data.title: Draw navigation debug geometry in Editor
No way to recieve normal of NavMesh poly
data.body:
I use this code for positioning obstacles

```
Vector3 pos = Vector3(Random(90.0f) - 45.0f, 0.0f, Random(90.0f) - 45.0f);
pos = navMesh->FindNearestPoint(pos, Vector3(0.0f, 100.0f, 0.0f));
```

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/18203381/6a65d604-711f-11e6-94b2-d4f4d35a0aba.png)

Obstacle not parallel to navmesh, but only touch single side. And navmesh generates incorrect (agent passes through the obstacle).

When I move node down:

```
            Vector3 pos = Vector3(Random(90.0f) - 45.0f, 0.0f, Random(90.0f) - 45.0f);
            pos = navMesh->FindNearestPoint(pos, Vector3(0.0f, 100.0f, 0.0f));
            pos += Vector3::DOWN * 0.3f;
```

all works correct:

![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/18203529/3d3c0d5a-7120-11e6-9c2a-de5994ab0aca.png)

but then for the obstacles its needed to create a separate node. Also it is difficult to determine what value the node must be immersed (the slope can be steep). But in any case, the object is also to be rotated parallel to the ground.

So I think FindNearestPoint should also return normal of NavMesh

data.title: NavMesh not updated when node with obstacle is moved
Reloading any resource make attribute editor lose focus.
data.body:
If I force reloading of some resource when I am editing component attributes, text fields lose focus, up/down buttons hangs, etc and editing became unconvinient.
I am working on asset generation, so such case is important to me.
Do you have thoughts about the reason of such behavior?
Could you fix it or give me some ideas how I can do it by myself?

data.title: Adding elements from [POD]Vector to itself crashes applictaion.
data.body:
Any insertions that consume elements from the same vector may crash applictaion because of wrong resize implementation.

```
    Vector<String> vec = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
    vec.Push(vec.Front()); // Dies here
```

data.body: ... because otherwise we can retreive 'next mip levels' endlessly.

data.title: IntVector2::ToHash()
data.body:
Hello

I think it's common in games that IntVector2 is used as a key in set or map. For example, I use it to keep track of tiles that need updating. I think it needs to be hashable, so I can use it in HashSet. Hope I understood the HashSet correctly and hope you agree with me :)

About the hashing function. Why does it have two random numbers? Honestly, I don't know. I just made a wild guess that if I put two big prime numbers there, it's hard for hash numbers to make a collision.

data.title: Internal compiler error on MinGW GCC 6.2.0 x32
data.body:
I was trying to build Urho3D from repository source using MinGW GCC 6.2.0 x32 and I encountered a `internal compiler error: Segmentation fault` while it was building Bullet. I'm about to try a build without SSE to see if it affects anything. I know that SSE on MinGW was always an issue when building Bullet. Also try building with lower MinGW versions.

I've tried building Bullet from repository and seems to also generate several errors like this in other places (_VoronoiFractureDemo_). I'll report these to the Bullet repository.

```

In file included from E:/Urho3D/Source/ThirdParty/Bullet/src/LinearMath/btAlignedObjectArray.h:20:0,
                 from E:/Urho3D/Source/ThirdParty/Bullet/src/LinearMath/btHashMap.h:20,
```

data.title: Shadows artifacts since latest projection matrix code changes
data.body:
@cadaver So i am opening a proper issue for this bug.

I have tested it by compiling the engine just before the projection matrix branch merge and i can confirm that everything is working fine before the merge. But after that projection matrix branch merge i have shadow issues for all light source types but it is especially visible with terrain shadows. Like i said i have observed huge shadow quality degradation with objects lit by point and spot lights.

I have done my test on DX11 and PBR renderpath. 

GPU: NVidia GTX 760 (tested with two different drivers)

Here is a video of terrain shadow artifacts:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eLRxBge9L34

data.title: CrowdAgent speed decreased, when I rotate node in E_CROWD_AGENT_NODE_REPOSITION
Shadow depth bias (slope scale?) different on D3D and OpenGL
data.body: This is particularly noticeable on terrain slopes. OpenGL bias is stronger, while both D3D9 & D3D11 have similar weaker bias, which requires higher values to remove artifacts.

data.title: Add function to convert JSONValueType and JSONNumberType to String.
data.body:
Hi.

I'd like to propose adding a function to properly convert a `JSONValueType` and `JSONNumberType` to a `String`.

The reason I ask for this is because it would make turning a `JSONValue` into a `Variant` much easier, because `JSONValue::GetVariant()` expects the value to have been set using `JSONValue::SetVariant()`, as far as I know. And so, I wrote my own function to turn a value/number type into a string (I consider it very hacky, though).

With a built-in function to properly convert the value/number type to a string, we can get a proper `Variant` from the `JSONValue` via `JSONValue::GetVariantType(VariantType)` function, where we get the `VariantType` using `Variant::GetTypeFromName(String)`, where the string is the type name of the JSON value.

Thanks for reading.

data.title: Make PBR demo work on iOS
data.body:
Set of several issues:
1. PBRMaterial demo for iOS doesn't copy Autoload asset, so no PBR materials can be loaded by demo.
2. BRDF.glsl compile error at:
#116:         float lightScatter = f0 + (fd90 - f0) \* pow(1.0f - NdotL, 5.0f);
#117:         float viewScatter = f0 + (fd90 - f0) \* pow(1.0f - NdotV, 5.0f);

"f" is unexpected. If I delete "f" suffix, shader can be compiled.
3. PBR don't work as expected:

![img_0476](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9615945/18031012/0e17288e-6cde-11e6-8d8e-7a368706b0a6.PNG)

data.title: fbx causes assetimporter to crash
data.body:
The following fbx can be opened and viewed successfully in open3mod. But if importing in the editor, or using the assetimporter to import model, it will cause crash. Looks like caused by adding the supress pivot feature. If -np is used, it runs fine. but the exported model is wrong. 

[plane.zip](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/files/440573/plane.zip)

data.title: Add support of free functions as attribute accessors.
data.body:
This PR introduces three new macros URHO3D_ACCESSOR_ATTRIBUTE_FREE, URHO3D_ENUM_ACCESSOR_ATTRIBUTE_FREE and URHO3D_MIXED_ACCESSOR_ATTRIBUTE_FREE, that work exactly as their counterparts except that they receive free function pointers instead of member ones.

You could ask: 'Why do you need such strange case??'
However, I found this case useful because it allows to write lambda's just inside macros and don't bloat class public interface. Maybe there are some other cases, but this one is primary for me. These changes shouldn't disturb anything, so I have made PR.

**Update: Damn, I miscopypasted something..**
